metadata.title: CVE-2021-41689 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
DCMTK through 3.6.6 does not handle string copy properly. Sending specific requests to the dcmqrdb program, it would query its database and copy the result even if the result is null, which can incur a head-based overflow. An attacker can use it to launch a DoS attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-41689` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dcmtk - 3.6.7-5
libdcmtk17 - 3.6.7-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dcmtk package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6.7-5').
